gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਮਾਤਾ ਪਿਤਾ ਪਾਲਕ ਅਨੇਕ ਸੁਤ ਅਨਕ ਸੁਤਨ ਪੈ ਨ ਤੈਸੇ ਹੋੲਿ ਨ ਅਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Jaisay Maataa Pitaa Paalak Anayk Souta , Anak Soutan Pai N Taisay Hoi N Aavaee ?
translation: As parents bring up and care for many of their children yet £hose children do not reciprocate the same way;

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਮਾਤਾ ਪਿਤਾ ਚਿਤ ਚਾਹਤ ਹੈ ਸੁਤਨ ਕੳੁ ਤੈਸੇ ਨ ਸੁਤਨ ਚਿਤ ਚਾਹ ੳੁਪਜਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Jaisay Maataa Pitaa Chit Chaahat Hai Soutan Kau , Taisay N Soutan Chit Chaah Oupajaavaee ?
translation: As parents love their wards from the core of their hearts, the same intensity of love cannot be generated in the hearts of the children.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਮਾਤਾ ਪਿਤਾ ਸੁਤ ਸੁਖ ਦੁਖ ਸੋਗਾਨੰਦ ਦੁਖ ਸੁਖ ਮੈ ਨ ਤੈਸੇ ਸੁਤ ਠਹਰਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Jaisay Maataa Pitaa Sout Soukh Doukh Sogaananda , Doukh Soukh Mai N Taisay Sout Tthaharaavaee ?
translation: As parents feel delighted on the happy occasions of their children and are distressed when they face tribulations, but the children do not feel the reciprocal intensity for their parents;

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਮਨ ਬਚ ਕ੍ਰਮ ਸਿਖਨੁ ਲੁਡਾਵੈ ਗੁਰ ਤੈਸੇ ਗੁਰ ਸੇਵਾ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਨ ਹਿਤਾਵੲੀ ॥੧੦੧॥
transliteration: Jaisay Man Bach Kram Sikhanu Ludaavai Gur , Taisay Gur Sayvaa Gursikh N Hitaavaee ?101?
translation: As Satguru Ji pamper and cuddle the Sikhs with mind, words and deeds, similarly a Sikh cannot express in reciprocation these boons of Satguru Ji with equal intensity. (101)
